html: Assyria’s alliance of nations, each with its military specialty, makes up a formidable force: “Their arrows are sharp; all their bows are strung. The tread of their warhorses resembles flint; their chariot wheels revolve like a whirlwind” (Isaiah 5:28 ). As in the allegory of the vineyard, the enemy penetrates and occupies Jehovah’s people’s land: “I will have its hedge removed and let it be burned; I will have its wall broken through and let it be trampled. I will make it a desolation” (Isaiah 5:5-6 ). Once defenses are breached, Jehovah’s unrepentant people seek places of resort in the woods (cf. Isaiah 8:22 ).
